intro: Calyptranthes calderonii, commonly known as the Calderón's calyptranthes, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Theaceae, which includes camellias and other ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, elliptical leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks or in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
